job_title: Support Services Assistant in Atlanta, GA
pros: The work environment is very friendly and helpful. You gain customer service and entry-level IT experience working within Spelman Technology Services.
cons: Users may call the help desk while already agitated and aggravated by an issue that you are expected to assist with, and you must remain composed.

pros: Off for Summer and work hours
cons: Low Growth potential or advice

pros: The admissions officers and the director of admissions were incredible to work with. It was great to be a part of so many future Spelmanites journey, and the schedule was flexible to accommodate my classes.
cons: Belinda was truly a boss from hell. She had it out for the student workers in the office and that grown woman took pleasure from bullying and belittling students. If you stood up to her she would cut your hours or not renew your job for the following semester. She made a point to single out student workers she didn’t like and created a bad workplace.

pros: The opportunity to interact with the students positively is priceless. Great bennies. Convenient location.
cons: These Black women (the workers) carry around the typical nasty, judgemental, shallow, narrow, biased Atlanta attitude. Disappointing.

pros: Love the students! Faculty and staff are dedicated.
cons: Top heavy administration unaware of many student concerns.

pros: Working with women of color. Strong support system.
cons: Disorganized, a lot of gossip, and not professional staff members.

pros:

pros: It's a work-study job and the hours are flexible for students.
cons: The pay is very low and we can only work a maxumum of 10 hours per week. You will need a second job in order to realistically make enough to get by.

pros: Devoted mission statement, growth opportunities

pros: Wonderful place to work. really.
cons: no cons. really. thought it was great.

pros: love it so very much

review_title: Asks a lot but gives a little
pros: Great to work with some of the brightest black women in the Nation.
cons: A lot of service and focus on teaching and not much support for research.

pros: Love working at Spelman College
cons: Spelman College could have more staff

job_title: Leadership Gift Officer in Atlanta, GA
pros: Great community of people and environment.
cons: I dont have any cons.

pros: Great, familial atmosphere. Everyone is very dedicated to their work and the mission of the College.
cons: It's a great place to work!

job_title: Senior Investment Analyst in Atlanta, GA
pros: Great college, campus, lovely school culture
cons: Poor management and staff are very unprofessional

pros: Inspiring, motivating, historic, beautiful campus, close to downtown

job_title: Math Lab Tutor in Atlanta, GA
pros: Wonderful place to work as a student.
cons: The pay can be low.

review_title: Worthy ideals, but lack of clarity, objectivity, and resources make it a struggle to function and thrive here.
pros: To have the "HBCU" experience; to get grounded in African-American history and issues; to work in a liberal arts environment; to contribute to preparing African-American students to serve and to lead.  The students are wonderful!
cons: Biased, unobjective, and capricious evaluation criteria and processes that are far too vague to fairly evaluate within specific disciplines.  Inefficient, inadequate processes and resources to support educators.  Policies and expectations inconsistent with resources and support services provided to faculty.  Secretive, arbitrary, and unvalidated deliberations involving tenure and  promotion.  (Feedback to candidates and the opportunity for them to respond during--rather than after-- these processes is sorely lacking.)  Sometimes a narrow and isolated view of what it means to be a college that serves students of African descent.

review_title: It felt like I was the outcast in a sorority.  And being an adjunct Professor, I was never a pledge
pros: The students are great, the message is great, the motto is great.  the leadership has great vision, but I never understood how it would be implemented.
cons: Administration needs to be updated, half of their jobs could be replaced by technology.  Also, it functions like a feudal society.  I had to "bow down" and schmooze to get people to do their job.  Also, there is no transparency with the budget or even with employee evaluations.  My contract wasn't renewed, and they said it was because the provost decided not to rehire me or the budget didn't allow.  When the truth was I was too forward with the fact that I knew I could host a summer program in an empty room and was vocal when administration was slow with paperwork.

pros: Staff are allowed to participate in Spelman College activities and have full access to the wellness center.
cons: The admissions office at Spelman has had extreme turn-over for the past decade.  A lot of reoccurring issues that management overlooks and refuses to address.  No room for improvement or professional development.  Unless you are hired into a position of leadership, I do not recommend joining admissions as a team member.  Sad to say, but there is a lot of favoritism within admissions.  Since Spelman has an elitist-driven culture, it would probably do more harm than good if one were to take initiative in addressing discrimination in the workplace there.  During my time in admissions, most people resigned from their position out of frustration and moved into lateral positions just to escape the toxic and stagnant work environment.

review_title: To be the educator and leader that sports taught me to be for the students that have become family members of today..
pros: Spelman was a ground to teach highly academic young ladies to understand that they could learn to be leaders based on being well rounded individuals, to nurture their time and energy and give back to others.
cons: I would say during the sports season my travel time was difficult for me during 7 months of the year, I enjoy family time and those days made me understand my elongated family was my team/students.

job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Atlanta, GA
pros: Great school legacy, wonderful student population, beautiful campus
cons: Spelman has a great deal of office politics.  They tend to hire Spelman Alumnae who could care less about their Alma Mater and are only there to collect a pay check in order to make it to retirement. Thus overlooking employees who bring value to their jobs to advance the mission of the college.  Spelman has lost a lot of good talent because of this.

pros: Great Students, Great Faculty, Great atmosphere for learning.  The legacy of the HBCU is rich at Spelman as an educator I had a panoply of students from around the globe, Asian, White, Black it was awesome.
cons: Poor Administration.  I came to the institution in a very stormy season, major staff turn over and I observed the worst management of the institutions greatest asset--Its educators, who were treated as expendable.  Some of the chief H.R. and Admin. offenders are gone some are not.

review_title: Diverse workplace of fun and commitment
job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Atlanta, GA
pros: Campus is lovely, Spelman is very health conscious, benefits are great, and very fun work environment, compensation, events, Restaurants on site, very clean work environment, updated computer equipment, free coffee and water, mail center, bookstore, vendors, gym and pool use for employees
cons: The neighborhood outside the perimeter of the college isn't great and there are always crimes reported in the area but Security on campus is great. There is a monthly charge for employee parking but the rates are affordable, traffic is very heavy in the area for the evening commute.

pros: I tought it would give me the chance to advance my career
cons: Working in the Facilities department was one of the worst mistakes ,i've made worked there for a few years ,thinking that I was going to have the chance to move up the career ladder only to them hire someone else from the outside , the guy wasn't even qualified and always needed my help to perform his job , I would work for Spelman College again in the future ,but I'd stay away from the facilities department

pros: Working at Spelman could probably be a hassle. Fortunately, my boss is excellent and deals with a lot of the office politics so that we don't have to.
cons: Spelman, like a lot of other colleges I'm sure, is not very efficient. There is a lot of politics and favoritism. And a lot of elitism. However, if you find the right people, most anything can be rectified.

pros:
Flexible hours
training courses were clear and short in length
the info was valuable and up to date with current tech trends
very savvy with compatibility for every student's needs
cons:
work duties during school wide events
sometimes felt like we couldn't have any events that catered to the growing trends
students only come to us when then need us during midterms and finals
not visible, or seen to be less important by students

job_title: Student Technology Assistant in Atlanta, GA
pros: My supervisor was always willing to listen to our ideas . If she agreed with an idea, she would allow it to develop and be a product that we'd showcase on campus. If the idea was really bad (in a few cases) she would consult the senior members of our department.They would teach us new ways of engaging Spelmanites to use our technology services.
cons: Sometimes our ideas and proposed programs were bigger than our budget.

job_title: Student Accounts Coordinator in Atlanta, GA
pros: You have to the flexibility to work on special projects outside of your department.  As an Alumna, I looked forward to that.
cons: No growth potential, low pay, and under handed management and not open to change.  Every time a suggestion was made, it was virtually shot down with no usually no explanation.  Management is stuck in their ways and just keeping a seat warm until retirement.

job_title: Office of the Provost, Student Assistant in Atlanta, GA
pros: Specifically as a student employee, working in the Provosts office is easily one of the best jobs on campus. Everyone in there is do supportive and understanding. They always emphasize that school work comes first and will change your schedule accordingly
cons: I honestly can't think of any. It would be nice if there were a little more space for the student employees but, I know that's hard to change.

pros: Apartment & meal plan for RD's
cons: Low salary and unwilling to negotiate. If you ask to negotiate, you'll be starting off on the wrong foot. Lack of communication across the entire campus. I remember talking to HR and feeling like they were insecure because I tried to negotiate some things and had questions they couldn't answer. They got defensive and were very pushy. Housing department is a hot mess and lacks communication!

review_title: Job was micro-managed by supervisor who did not have the necessary technical knowledge to do so.
pros: Excellent salary & benefits.  Safe work environment.
cons: Very poor work ethic and lack of skills & experience for the related tasks.  Tend to hire unexperienced temporary help.  Very beurocratic & institutional.

job_title: Computer Lab Monitor in Atlanta, GA
pros: Being able to choose your hours, having the ability to work around your class schedule
cons: Not much actual work to do; mainly just busy work to pass the time in monitoring the labs

pros:
* Generally tries to keep moral high with great activities throughout the year.

* Beautiful campus and honor to work for historic HBCU

* Great benefits

* Small IT group 30 people. Great for building some great relationships.
cons:
* No vision for dept. and called in consultants to help shape units vision. 

* Lack of understanding of latest technologies and the school is well behind other universities in serving its students. For, example students made a youtube video rap complaining about how slow the schools network is. No student workers in IT to assist in development. The IT department has no identity and students don't know it's purpose or value to the university. This is especially demoralizing to a web developer as one of its main purpose is to portray that identity to stakeholders. 

* Power struggles and politics. The IT department and Web team are separate. The web team is under communications dept. The spelman main website is the worst site I have ever seen for a prestigious university. Note this is NOT due to employees but, leadership and lack vision. Leadership is too busy cat fighting to realize that the student who pay their salary see them as incompetent. So please note that the web developer in MIT will always be at odds with web developers in communications. You will frequently get emails from communications leadership challenging you and calling for meetings.

* No development or service oriented methodologies in place. The ticketing system was great but, useless as the rules IT had in place were not adhered to. One call or email to leadership and IT staff had to drop everything to meet that need no matter its importance. 

* Project management is non existent. I managed my own projects and we had no one to go to bat for us when staff asked for non production or non emergency changes.

* A lot of work for little pay.

Bottom line is if you are a seasoned web developer this is not the place for you as no one in leadership understands the importance of the web or social media. I definitely would not recomend this position to a young developer due to zero training and politics. 

I choose to move on for a better challenge and a better fit.

Inside tips:

1. They lowered the salary for this position after I left.
2. You will be one of only 3 real object oriented programmers at the university. Stay hidden.
3. If you have Java/J2EE fundamentals don't waist your time. 
4. The position asks for 5 years of exp. If you are a seasoned web developer you are wasting your time at the new lowered salary.

review_title: Not a lot of organization and cohesion across campus
pros: People are generally nice, easy-going, and supportive
cons: A lot of disorganization and confusion about the work that connects across campus; different departments aren't clued into how their work impacts and depends on work happening across campus.

review_title: If you're young, DO NOT waste your years here.
pros:
-Free gym. 
-Free shuttle from West End Marta Station. 
-Paid holiday vacation for Christmas Break. 
-Nice work life balance
cons:
- If you don't have children, their major benefit of free education is useless. 
-No room for growth because people stay in their positions for YEARS. 
-Stuck in the old ways of doing things. All "new" technology goes to the students first (and pretty much only). 
-Many of the seasoned employees are "scared" of change
-FAVORITISM
-Upper management/senior team has no clue what's going on beneath them

pros: Great students. Beautiful campus. Active city.
cons: Horrible administration. There is little to no room for advancement. HR is unreliable and will always side with the supervisor or senior team leader.  Never consider being the whistleblower or you will find yourself being punished.

pros: The workplace atmosphere is unbeatable! Such a nurturing and supportive staff. It truly was a pleasure.
cons: The pay and benefits could be better. It was a lot of work for not enough in return. But overall very pleasant.

job_title: Social Media Assistant in Atlanta, GA
pros: Everyone there seems to care about you and your progress.
cons: There is a clear pyramid of hierarchy and the students workers are treated like children, not adults.

review_title: Spelman College Office of Housing and Residence Life
pros: While being a resident advisor I have built very strong relationships with my residents, and I have been able to counsel my residents on various matters.
cons: This job can be very stressful and challenging.

review_title: i sure do miss the math lab
pros:
nice work environment - respectable
able to make friends well tutor students in areas they needed assistance in
the math lab was my fav place to be on campus esp when i moved off campus
cons: only able to work 10hrs a week :(

pros: The work isn't that difficult and everyone is friendly.
cons: There isn't much invested in the way of training and pay raises are not guaranteed.

pros: Ideal community environment, great opportunity to grow and develop your career and personal self. I really enjoyed the team support and community involvement with the department.

pros: Interacting with students and student centered programs

review_title: Great experience working for Spelman College. Would recommend this job to any one.

pros: Friendly staff, plenty of overtime if you prove to know your stuff

pros: Benefits fair. Small community. Friendly people. I enjoy working here.
